articles.title: NWSL to consider reproductive rights as part of expansion process
articles.description: NWSL Commissioner Jessica Berman said reproductive rights will be considered when the league looks at locations for possible expansion teams.
articles.content:

articles.author: Jeremy SchaapSportsCenter Reporter/Host, Classic Sports Reporters
articles.title: IOC reinstates Jim Thorpe as sole winner of 1912 Olympic decathlon and pentathlon
articles.description: Jim Thorpe, stripped of two gold medals because he'd been paid to play minor league baseball, was reinstated by the IOC on Thursday as the sole winner of the decathlon and pentathlon at the Stockholm Olympics.
articles.content: Jim Thorpe, stripped of his 1912 gold medals because he'd been paid to play minor league baseball, was reinstated Thursday as the sole winner of that year's Olympic decathlon and pentathlon by the In… [+2799 chars]

articles.title: Phoenix Suns match Indiana Pacers' 4-year, $133 million offer sheet to Deandre Ayton
articles.description: The Suns matched the Pacers four-year, $133 million offer sheet for restricted free agent center Deandre Ayton, clearing the way for him to return to the franchise, his agents Bill Duffy and Nima Namakian told ESPN.

articles.title: Back-to-back champ Pete Alonso to open 2022 MLB Home Run Derby with Ronald Acuna Jr. rematch
articles.description: Pete Alonso will face Ronald Acuna Jr. in a rematch of 2019 while top seed Kyle Schwarber matches up with Albert Pujols in the first round of the 2022 Home Run Derby.
articles.content:
Gunning for history, back-to-back champion Pete Alonso will start his pursuit of a third title as the No. 2 seed in the 2022 Home Run Derby on Monday night at Dodgers Stadium.

articles.title: Rookie Cameron Young shoots 8-under 64, leads Open Championship
articles.description: PGA Tour rookie Cameron Young made his Open Championship debut with an 8-under 64 at St. Andrews. Rory McIlroy shot a 66 and is in second after the first round.
articles.content:
ST. ANDREWS, Scotland -- The Old Course was never faster. The pace of play was never slower.

articles.title: Agent Casey Close sues Fox Sports radio host Doug Gottlieb for libel over tweet about contract offer to Los Angeles Dodgers' Freddie Freeman
articles.description: Agent Casey Close sued Fox Sports radio host Doug Gottlieb for libel, alleging Gottlieb "falsely and recklessly" defamed Close with a tweet that claimed Close and his agency hadn't presented a contract offer to Freddie Freeman during free agency.

articles.author: Mark SchlabachESPN Senior Writer
articles.title: Tiger Woods unable to tame windy conditions, shoots first-round 78 at The Open
articles.description: Playing in the afternoon wave, which had windier and much more difficult conditions than the morning group, Tiger Woods carded a 6-over 78 in the first round of The Open. He was 14 shots behind leader Cameron Young after 18 holes.
